text: Indonesia first competed in the Olympic Games in 1952. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Indonesia is INA. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-8-16. ==History== Indonesia was first at the Olympic Games in 1952. They have been in every Summer Olympic Games since then, except for 1964 and 1980. Indonesia has been in the Youth Olympic Games but not Winter Olympic Games. The National Olympic Committee for Indonesia was formed in 1946 and recognized in 1952. ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event , Nurfitriyana Saiman, Kusuma Wardhani 1988 Seoul Archery Women's team 1992 Barcelona Badminton Men's singles 1992 Barcelona Badminton Women's singles 1992 Barcelona Badminton Men's singles and Rudy Gunawan 1992 Barcelona Badminton Men's doubles 1992 Barcelona Badminton Men's singles and Ricky Subagja 1996 Atlanta Badminton Men's doubles 1996 Atlanta Badminton Women's singles and Denny Kantono 1996 Atlanta Badminton Men's doubles 1996 Atlanta Badminton Women's singles and Candra Wijaya 2000 Sydney Badminton Men's doubles and Minarti Timur 2000 Sydney Badminton Mixed doubles Hendrawan 2000 Sydney Badminton Men's singles 2000 Sydney Weightlifting Women's 48 kg 2000 Sydney Weightlifting Women's 48 kg 2000 Sydney Weightlifting Women's 53 kg 2004 Athens Badminton Men's singles 2004 Athens Weightlifting Women's 53 kg 2004 Athens Badminton Men's singles and Flandy Limpele 2004 Athens Badminton Men's doubles and 2008 Beijing Badminton Men's Doubles and Lilyana Natsir 2008 Beijing Badminton Mixed doubles 2008 Beijing Badminton Women's singles 2008 Beijing Weightlifting Men's 56 kg 2008 Beijing Weightlifting Men's 62 kg 2012 London Weightlifting Men's 62 kg 2012 London Weightlifting Men's 69 kg ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes == References == ==Other websites == * * Indonesia profile at London2012.com Category:Sport in Indonesia Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Indonesia
